Class Conversation

Represents on ongoing chat with back-and-forth interactions between the user and the chatbot. This is the simplest way to interact with the ChatGPT API, rather than manually using the ChatEnpoint methods. You do lose some flexibility though.

Conversation(ChatEndpoint, Model, ChatRequest)

Creates a new conversation with ChatGPT chat

Declaration
public Conversation(ChatEndpoint endpoint, Model model = null, ChatRequest defaultChatRequestArgs = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
ChatEndpoint endpoint

A reference to the API endpoint, needed for API requests. Generally should be Chat.
Model model

Optionally specify the model to use for ChatGPT requests. If not specified, used defaultChatRequestArgs.Model or falls back to DefaultChatModel
ChatRequest defaultChatRequestArgs

Allows setting the parameters to use when calling the ChatGPT API. Can be useful for setting temperature, presence_penalty, and more. See OpenAI documentation for a list of possible parameters to tweak.

Properties

| Improve this Doc View Source

AutoTruncateOnContextLengthExceeded

Sometimes the total length of your conversation can get too long to fit in the ChatGPT context window. In this case, the OnTruncationNeeded event will be called, if supplied. If not supplied and this is true, then the first one or more user or assistant messages will be automatically deleted from the beginning of the conversation message history until the API call succeeds. This may take some time as it may need to loop several times to clear enough messages. If this is set to false and no OnTruncationNeeded is supplied, then an System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException will be raised when the API returns a context_length_exceeded error.

Declaration
public bool AutoTruncateOnContextLengthExceeded { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Boolean
| Improve this Doc View Source

Messages

A list of messages exchanged so far. To append to this list, use AppendMessage(ChatMessage), AppendUserInput(String, ChatMessage.ImageInput[]), AppendSystemMessage(String), or AppendExampleChatbotOutput(String).

Declaration
public IList<ChatMessage> Messages { get; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Collections.Generic.IList<ChatMessage>

Model

Specifies the model to use for ChatGPT requests. This is just a shorthand to access RequestParameters.Model

| Improve this Doc View Source

MostRecentApiResult

After calling GetResponseFromChatbotAsync(), this contains the full response object which can contain useful metadata like token usages, FinishReason, etc. This is overwritten with every call to GetResponseFromChatbotAsync() and only contains the most recent result.

Declaration
public ChatResult MostRecentApiResult { get; }
Property Value
Type Description
ChatResult

AppendExampleChatbotOutput(String)

Creates and appends a ChatMessage to the chat history with the Role of Assistant. Assistant messages can be written by a developer to help give examples of desired behavior.

Declaration
public void AppendExampleChatbotOutput(string content)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String content

Text content written by a developer to help give examples of desired behavior

Parameters
Type Name Description
ChatMessage message

The ChatMessage to append to the chat history
| Improve this Doc View Source

AppendMessage(ChatMessageRole, String, ChatMessage.ImageInput[])

Creates and appends a ChatMessage to the chat history

Declaration
public void AppendMessage(ChatMessageRole role, string text, params ChatMessage.ImageInput[] images)
Parameters
Type Name Description
ChatMessageRole role

The ChatMessageRole for the message. Typically, a conversation is formatted with a system message first, followed by alternating user and assistant messages. See the OpenAI docs for more details about usage.
System.String text

The text content of the message
ChatMessage.ImageInput[] images

Optionally, one or more images to include in the message. Only works with GPT Vision models, so be sure to set your model correctly. Consider using FromFile(String, String) to load an image from a local file, or FromImageUrl(String, String) to point to an image via URL. Please see https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/vision for more information and limitations.
| Improve this Doc View Source

AppendSystemMessage(String)

Creates and appends a ChatMessage to the chat history with the Role of System. The system message helps set the behavior of the assistant.

AppendUserInput(String, ChatMessage.ImageInput[])

Creates and appends a ChatMessage to the chat history with the Role of User. The user messages help instruct the assistant. They can be generated by the end users of an application, or set by a developer as an instruction.

Declaration
public void AppendUserInput(string text, params ChatMessage.ImageInput[] images)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String text

Text content generated by the end users of an application, or set by a developer as an instruction
ChatMessage.ImageInput[] images

Optionally, one or more images to include in the message. Only works with GPT Vision models, so be sure to set your model correctly. Consider using FromFile(String, String) to load an image from a local file, or FromImageUrl(String, String) to point to an image via URL. Please see https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/vision for more information and limitations.

GetResponseFromChatbotAsync()

Calls the API to get a response, which is appended to the current chat's Messages as an Assistant ChatMessage.

Declaration
public async Task<string> GetResponseFromChatbotAsync()
Returns
Type Description
System.Threading.Tasks.Task<System.String>

The string of the response from the chatbot API
| Improve this Doc View Source

StreamResponseEnumerableFromChatbotAsync()

Calls the API to get a response, which is appended to the current chat's Messages as an Assistant ChatMessage, and streams the results as they come in.
If you are not using C# 8 supporting async enumerables or if you are using the .NET Framework, you may need to use StreamResponseFromChatbotAsync(Action<String>) instead.

Declaration
public async IAsyncEnumerable<string> StreamResponseEnumerableFromChatbotAsync()
Returns
Type Description
System.Collections.Generic.IAsyncEnumerable<System.String>

An async enumerable with each of the results as they come in. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/whats-new/csharp-8#asynchronous-streams for more details on how to consume an async enumerable.
| Improve this Doc View Source

StreamResponseFromChatbotAsync(Action<Int32, String>)

Calls the API to get a response, which is appended to the current chat's Messages as an Assistant ChatMessage, and streams the results to the resultHandler as they come in.
If you are on the latest C# supporting async enumerables, you may prefer the cleaner syntax of StreamResponseEnumerableFromChatbotAsync() instead.

Declaration
public async Task StreamResponseFromChatbotAsync(Action<int, string> resultHandler)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Action<System.Int32, System.String> resultHandler

An action to be called as each new result arrives, which includes the index of the result in the overall result set.
Returns
Type Description
System.Threading.Tasks.Task

Events

| Improve this Doc View Source

OnTruncationNeeded

An event called when the chat message history is too long, which should reduce message history length through whatever means is appropriate for your use case. You may want to remove the first entry in the System.Collections.Generic.List<T> in the System.EventArgs

Declaration
public event EventHandler<List<ChatMessage>> OnTruncationNeeded
Event Type
Type Description
System.EventHandler<System.Collections.Generic.List<ChatMessage>>
